comments:
3.0 RC 2

Sometimes Eclipse would crash when I synchronize and it's switching to the
Synchronize perspective. Before 3.0 RC 2, it would not log anything, so I didn't
know what the problem was.

But now it just logged an SWTError (see attachment) when it crashed, so I guess
this is the same error when it was not logging.

Created an attachment (id=12122)
Eclipse .log file (see end of it)

The error occurred on linux-gtk.

Please note that I have torn off some views into their own windows. I'm not sure
if this is related to the error, just wanted to mention it.

Please let me know if you need any more information.

3.0RC3 WinXP

Happened when I chose to remove a file from the view. Synchronize view is on
second monitor. OS: Windows 2000.

happens every 5 minutes here no matter what I do
(fresh 3.x installation but a number if very large
 java-projects that depend on each other and have
 ant-builds parallel to the eclipse-builds)

Maik's original log showed the error below.  This is quite different from the 
error reported by Christof.  Christof, if your problem is still happening, 
please open a separate bug report with your error.  Daniel and Markus, more 
information is required.  If you do not have the same error trace as is shown 
below, please enter a separate bug report with steps showing how to reproduce 
the problem.

I found similar bug-reports stating this as an SWT vs. graphics-driver problem.
changing color-depth as suggested for nvidia and ATI did not help.

I am using a Matrox G4XX under Windows2000.
The problem got away when I switched the multiscreen-mode from
[ ] different resolution and colors for each display to
[x] same -"-

This bug is quite old.  The failure is in internal_new_GC() on a Control.  There
is no expected case where this code can fail except for being out of resources
in the X server or out of memory on the system.

Unless this is reproducable in a released version of 3.0 or a version of 3.1, I
do not think this is worth keeping this bug open.

Closing as INVALID, please file a new bug against Platform > SWT if you are
seeing "no more handles" errors like the ones reported here.
